definition: to supply/to provide for one's elders/to support one's parents
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: The Buddha takes his last offerings and makes your perfect in danaparamita. well done, Cunda!
sentences.chinese: 佛陀接受了他的最后的供养并且因为布施而使你最好。

sentences.english: Yet coal mines are as much a part of China's civilization as paddy fields.
sentences.chinese: 然而，煤矿就像是供养中国文明成长的稻田。

sentences.english: Hold feeding programs with non-profit organizations.
sentences.chinese: 和非营利组织一起开展供养项目。

sentences.english: Danapati Bodhisattva, Tang dynasty, cave fresco, cave 401, Mogao grottoes, Dunhuang.
sentences.chinese: 供养菩萨，唐，石窟壁画，敦煌莫高窟第401窟。

sentences.english: The one who practices while turning equals the fortune of the thousand buddhas.
sentences.chinese: 边修边转嘛尼轮的功德与供养千佛的功德相等。

sentences.english: I am support by my parents when I am study.
sentences.chinese: 我求学期间由父母供养。

sentences.english: 'It's difficult to raise a family on one income. '
sentences.chinese: 单靠一个人的收入很难供养一家子。

sentences.english: If more money comes in, Nalanda will use it to repair the leaking roof of the old building.
sentences.chinese: 供养金若超过所需，馀额即将用以修葺旧舍屋顶。

sentences.english: He offered me a morsel of food.
They drain the spirit of them to nourish their large roots, trunks and leaves.
sentences.chinese: 用尖刺抽干灵魂供养巨大的根茎和枝叶。

sentences.english: The vast majority are supported by their parents.
sentences.chinese: 他们多数都是由自己的父母供养。

sentences.english: Today, there are three working-age Europeans for every one over 65.
sentences.chinese: 今天，平均三个工作人供养一个65岁以上的老人。

sentences.english: The problem of ratio of finical- supporting population is always the spotlight of our county.
sentences.chinese: 中国财政供养人口比的增长一直备受人们的关注。

sentences.english: I must work hard to make money to send my grandchildren to school.
sentences.chinese: 我必须努力赚钱来供养我们的孙子上学。

sentences.english: They support their families. They try to make an honest living the best they can.
sentences.chinese: 他们努力工作，供养家庭，尝试将诚信生活变得最好。

sentences.english: There was an old woman in China who had supported a monk for over twenty years.
sentences.chinese: 中国一老媪，专门供养一个和尚二十年。

definition: to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
to provide for/to keep (animals, a family etc)/to raise animals/to feed and clothe/support/the necessities of life/to give birth
to consecrate/to enshrine and worship/an offering (to one's ancestors)/a sacrifice (to a God)
to show filial respect/to give presents (to one's elders or superiors)/to support one's aged parents
emergency relief/to help the needy with cash or goods
to support/to provide support for/to maintain
to convert to (a religion)/to rely upon/refuge/mainstay
